messages.subject: Fw: Samurai family
messages.msgSnippet: Dear All, My cross-post from another list Having a trawl I found this which may be of interest to some: http://www.unterstein.net/or/docs/JapanPeers.pdf SOME
messages.messageBody:
Dear All,

My cross-post from another list

Having a trawl I found this which may be of interest to some:

http://www.unterstein.net/or/docs/JapanPeers.pdf

SOME INFORMATION ON NOBILITY,
PEERAGE AND RANKS IN ANCIENT
AND MEIJI-JAPAN

It's in French and English.

Regards,

Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: Craig Harris
To: token_kenkyu_kai@...
Sent: Saturday, August 11, 2007 10:17 AM
Subject: Re: Samurai family





On 8/10/07, ikkanshi@... <ikkanshi@...> wrote:
Hi all, does anyone know of a samurai family from the mid 1700's from I suspect Bitchu province by the name of Hiramatsu.

This is taken from the Haynes Indexes and they are referred to as the Bitchu Hiramatsu family.

Cheers

Richard


Papinot has a listing for Hiramatsu: "A kuge family descended from the Taira - The head is now Viscount." [now meaning 1910]

Nothing in the Biographical Dictionary of Japanese History or Kodansha Encyclopedia.

I'll keep looking ...

Craig

--
Craig Harris
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
